definition: to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: The madrigal he wrote are still Sung by people.
sentences.chinese: 他寫的情歌仍然還在被人們傳唱。

sentences.english: And sung by children in succeeding times.
sentences.chinese: 被孩子們傳唱，暮暮朝朝。

sentences.english: With songs they have sung for a thousand years, The hills fill my heart with the sound of music.
sentences.chinese: 傳唱千年的歌聲在飄揚，山巒喚起我心中的音樂。

sentences.english: A new generation is now growing up singing some of musical theater's favorite songs.
sentences.chinese: 新一代的聽衆已成爲傳唱音樂劇的經典歌曲了。

sentences.english: It is perhaps the most performed song in the world.
sentences.chinese: 這也許是世界上被傳唱最多的歌曲。

definition: singing voice/fig. original voice of a poet
old style/old custom/a pre-Tang Dynasty genre of poetry aka 古體詩|古体诗[ɡu3 ti3 shi1]
to shake up/to deal a shock/(fig.) to stir (sb's heart)
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
to read aloud/to recite rhythmically/to chant/to intone (esp. poems in rhythm)
